page.title: 11AN INTERESTING SUNDAY
page.content: On Sunday my family and I went to Graigevar Castle which was pure pink. Outside there were two huge trees, one was measured 90 feets and the other 80 feet in 1975. They were presents from Canada. The castle was seven storeys high. It was built in 1625. It said this in nearly every ceiling of the castle, there were at least 4 or 5 rooms on each floor. It used to be a guest house until 1972 when it was given to the National Trust. There were two rooms, one of them was a nursery and another for upto 18 years old. They were not allowed out of the castle till then. There was one room which was called The Tarten Room, opposite this room was The Blue Room. We were not allowed to go all the way up because the castle was getting old and it would not hold all of us if we went up.
